messages.message: anant is wondering why file service is blazingly fast on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) right now
I was very curious about this too on my own sandbox - I think it is purely a load thing? Looking at grafana, seems like very little load is happening right now
Huh, does this mean file service has a memory leak?
Surprised it is slowly going up over time, unless we do caching?
It’s likely just going up in memory until it hits some limit and the gc kicks in to free it

As of May release, we have enabled grpc-file-service on prod for read and write operations, so that may explain a change in performance (we’ve cut out a couple API calls along those paths :slightly_smiling_face: )
I think that might be restarts @Heymian :smile: python is a memory leaker TBH
we’re doing some deeper benchmarking on resource usage this week & next so we should be able to get a better idea of whats going on soon! (it does look like there was a redeploy at that time)
Yeah I think it’s restarts because they are different colors and therefore different instances
